name: Business Sweden Europe
description:
Business Sweden helps Swedish companies grow global sales and international companies invest and expand in Sweden.

For Swedish companies, we provide strategic advice, sales execution and operational support to help them grow their international revenues. For international companies we ensure that they can rely on our knowledge, experience and extensive network to identify new business opportunities and achieve an accelerated return on investment. We have achieved our expertise by being present in the world's 50 most promising markets for over 40 years, at the scene, helping to close the deal.

Europe is Sweden’s closest business region that offers untapped potential as well as new challenges. It consists of numerous markets that make up the world’s second largest economic entity and includes five of the world’s top 20 startup cities.  

The European markets may be geographically close, but it is worth remembering how diverse the region is.  As competition is rising, it is getting increasingly important to stay at the forefront of technological innovation and invest in strategic partnerships. Europe offers plenty of business possibilities across most industries. Prospects are particularly promising in the automotive industry energy and environment, health care and food, ICT as well as the creative industries. 

Business Sweden is represented throughout the region, with 16 offices from Madrid to Moscow.

company_updates_collection.description:
The Nordic Scottish Summit 2022 concluded in late November after two days at the Glasgow City Chambers! 

We are delighted to have welcomed over 100 Nordic and Scottish delegates throughout the two days, including business representatives, industry organisations, academica, and the public sector. 

Participants had the opportunity to enjoy two days filled with interesting panel discussions, great networking opportunities, and valuable insights on how to accelerate the world’s green transition on the journey towards net-zero.  

The summit had the pleasure of receiving Ivan McKee, Minister for Business, Trade, Tourism and Enterprise and Susan Atkin Leader of Glasgow City Council. The event also welcomed Jukka Siukosaari, Ambassador of Finland and Mikaela Kumlin Granit, Ambassador of Sweden to speak to the audience in Glasgow. 

Representatives such as Philip Raines, Deputy Director for Domestic Climate Change, Scottish Government, Richard Rollison, Director for International Trade and Investment, Scottish Government, Councillor John Alexander, Councillor Angus Millar, Lord Provost, Councillor Jacqueline Mclaren also provided valuable insights to the audience. 
The summit also welcomed Paul Westin, Senior Business Developer from the Swedish Energy Agency. 

On behalf of the organising bodies, Nordisk Råd og Nordisk Ministerråd, Nordic Innovation, Business Sweden,Business Finland, Innovasjon Norge, The Trade Council of Denmark in UK and Ireland, The Scottish Government, Scottish Enterprise, Glasgow City Council we would like to thank you all for contributing to making the Nordic-Scottish Summit a success – and hope to see you at next year’s event!

Join Swiss Nordic Bio 2023 on 30 March in Zurich.

We are delighted to make this conference possible together with our co-host Vator Securities and partners Norway Health Tech, The Life Science Cluster, UBS, Invest in Skåne, Business Region Göteborg, Embassy of Sweden as well as the Swiss Innovation Agency Innosuisse  

With our main sponsor Nasdaq on board, we look forward to an engaging event.

To sign-up and for more information go to https://fal.cn/3uemM

We expect to welcome 200 life science professionals and investors at the conference. Already confirmed participants include, among others APUS Capital, Canica, Eiffel Investment Group, Hadean Ventures, Seventure Partners, IPF Partners, Wille Finance, XOventure, F. Hoffman-La Roche and Johnson & Johnson 

For the latest participant list, see this link here: https://fal.cn/3uemL.

#lifesciences #swissnordicbio #biotech #medtech #innovation #healthcare #ehealth #investment #healthcare #pharma #investors #digitalhealth #conference

Swedish companies impacted by Brexit can apply for 1 billion SEK through the Brexit Adjustment Reserve (BAR). In this webinar, you can find out how your company could benefit from the fund. 

Time: 8 December 13-14 GMT (14-15 CET). 
The last day to register is December 5.  

Participating speakers in the webinar will include:
• Gustaf Bergström, Trade Commissioner for UK and Ireland, Business Sweden
• Representatives from the Swedish ESF Council
• Åsa Theander, Deputy Head of Mission, Swedish Embassy in London
• Emma Sävenborg, Senior Adviser, Kommerskollegium | National Board of Trade Sweden 
• Helena Kohlström Ziegel, Trade Advisor and customs expert, Business Sweden

Sign up here: https://fal.cn/3u2sN

Looking to establish in Sweden to enter the growing Swedish battery sector? Our two day training gives you a shortcut into one of Europe’s most dynamic battery ecosystems.

The course enables international companies to quickly understand key areas and avoid common pitfalls, thereby saving both time and money when establishing in Sweden. Sign up today to get valuable insights into regulations, unwritten rules and business opportunities for your establishment within the Swedish battery sector.

Sign up here https://fal.cn/3tDS2

Only a few days left until this year's Swedish-German Business Day at the Nordic Embassies (and digital) on November 17, 11:00 - 13:00.

It starts with the Business Summit which will focus on Swedish-German collaboration for a competitive Europe, with discussions on Sweden’s upcoming EU Presidency and how Swedish-German collaboration can spearhead the green transition.

Sweden was partner country in this year's edition of the International Mobility Congress in Sitges, where the Swedish industry is represented by CAKE – ridecake.com, CTEK and Voi Technology, three excellent examples of the future of mobility. 

The congress offered Team Sweden Spain (the Embassy of Sweden in Madrid, Spain, Business Sweden, Cámara de Comercio Hispano-Sueca de Barcelona and the Consulate General of Sweden in Barcelona) and the Swedish SME delegation the opportunity to meet with local private and public stakeholders as well as to show best practices within sustainable mobility.

Save the date for SWISS NORDIC BIO 2023 our annual high-level partnering and investor conference for life science professionals from Switzerland and the Nordics.

Registration is now open. See https://fal.cn/3t6oZ for more information and to see already registered guests.

The Swedish-German Language Foundation promotes the mutual exchange of trade and culture between Sweden and Germany and works to improve understanding of German business culture within Swedish companies.

As part of the foundation’s promotional work, employees of Swedish companies with links to German trade and business are eligible to apply for a scholarship to improve their business German. The application for the autumn course is now open. Read more and apply using the link below. 
 
The Swedish-German Language Foundation is managed by a board appointed by the Government Offices, the Ministry for Foreign Affairs, the Confederation of Swedish Enterprise, the Embassy of Germany in Sweden, the German-Swedish Chamber of Commerce and Business Sweden.

#german #germany

ANSÖKAN ÖPPEN 
Svensk-tyska Språkfonden har nu öppnat ansökan för höstens stipendium i affärstyska. I november startar vår hybridkurs som innehåller både digital undervisning och två dagars fysisk utbildning i Berlin. Kursen riktar sig till anställda på svenska företag som kommer i kontakt med det tyska språket och dess kultur i affärssammanhang. Kursen fokuserar på proffessionella sammanhang, förhandlingsteknik, affärskultur, företagskultur och nätverkande.

Välkommen med Din ansökan! 

https://lnkd.in/dXAiQ2Yd

company_updates_collection.description:
Swedish and German manufacturers, start-ups, and technology providers are at the forefront of Europe’s efforts to reimagine the automotive industry, and together they are shaping the smart mobility solutions of the future.
 
As part of Sweden holding the EU Presidency for the first half of 2023, on 24th January 2023 the Embassy of Sweden in Germany, Business Sweden, the Swedish Honorary Consul in Munich, and Business Region Göteborg will host an exclusive investment matchmaking event at Hotel Bayerischer Hof München. The event will bring together technology and innovation drivers of leading German OEMs and Swedish mobility start-ups for a range of pitching sessions, key-note speeches, and a panel discussion followed by a vibrant dinner. 
 
We are thrilled to welcome representatives from leading OEMs and their corporate venture capital arms including Volkswagen AG, BMW i Ventures, HYUNDAI CRADLE, 1886Ventures, Robert Bosch Venture Capital, ZF Group and Polestar to explore the most innovative mobility solutions that Sweden has to offer, including Charge Amps , Carmenta, Elonroad, Uniquesec AB, AutoEnergy, Epinova AB, STILRIDE, RemotiveLabs, Univrses, NEVS, Consenz, REARQ, APR Technologies AB, Eways.se and Acconeer AB.

Sweden was partner country in last year's edition of the International Mobility Congress in Sitges, where the Swedish industry is represented by CAKE – ridecake.com, CTEK and Voi Technology, three excellent examples of the future of mobility.

The congress offered Team Sweden Spain (the Embassy of Sweden in Madrid, Spain, Business Sweden, Cámara de Comercio Hispano-Sueca de Barcelona and the Consulate General of Sweden in Barcelona) and the Swedish SME delegation the opportunity to meet with local private and public stakeholders as well as to show best practices within sustainable mobility. 

Read more: https://fal.cn/3uRkb

On Thursday 09th February 2023, Business Sweden together with the Embassy of Sweden London, UK and The Swedish Energy Agency International had the pleasure of hosting a roundtable for British and Swedish cooperation on district heating solutions at the Residence of the Swedish Ambassador in London - bringing together private companies, public organisations, industry associations and academic experts from both the United Kingdom & Sweden for a memorable evening of networking, interactive panels, and dinner discussions!

A big thank you must go to Lily Frencham, Chief Executive Officer, The Association of Decentralised Energy, Alan Unwin, Sales Manager UK & Ireland, Cetetherm, Charlotte Owen, Head of Policy and Local Partnerships, Pinnacle Power, Chris McBride, Strategic Engagement Manager - Heat Networks, Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS), Gemma Reeves, Business Unit Manager, Alfa Laval, Jeff Laidler, Managing Director, Sustainability Co, and Paul Steen, Head of Business Development Scotland, Vattenfall Heat UK. Paul Westin, Senior Business Developer, Energimyndigheten

Embassy of Sweden London, UK, Business Sweden, Energimyndigheten Sustainable Heating & Cooling by Sweden (SHC by Sweden)

Samiksha Jalan, Qahir Bandali, Carl-Oscar Westerlund,
Marika Amartey Kaliff, Therese Whitcomb-Eriksson, Christina Johannesson

 #PioneerThePossible #DistrictHeating #HeatNetworks #TeamSweden

Ahoy there! Calling all Swedish delegates attending MWC Barcelona! 

Do you want to add a bit of adventure to your conference experience? Come and join us for an evening on the high seas, well Barcelona’s port(!), onboard one of Sweden’s most famous historical tall ships, Gothenburg of Sweden. 

Meet the Captain, representatives from Team Sweden and fellow delegates such as mobilityXlab, BioVentureHub and Ericsson Consumer Lab that are looking for international startups with cutting edge technologies – all on the unique deck of an impressive ship designed in the 1700s. 

Spaces are limited, so click on the link to register ‘Aye, Aye’ for your chance to meet some local and global partners to discuss the bounty! 

Register here: https://fal.cn/3vLS4

In partnership with Vinnova and  Business Region Göteborg. 
Photo: Götheborg of Sweden #MWC23 #4YFN

On January 24, 2023, Business Sweden together with the Swedish Ambassador to Germany Per Thöresson, and Business Region Göteborg had the pleasure of hosting the first Swedish-German Mobility Innovation Forum in Munich – bringing together technology and innovation drivers of leading German OEMs and Swedish mobility start-ups for a for a memorable day of networking, pitching, and dinner discussions!

Special thank you to the thirteen Swedish start-ups which have pitched their incredible mobility solutions to the VC arms of some of Germany’s leading OEMs.

A big thank you also to Nikolai Ardey, Executive Director VW Group Innovation, Volkswagen AG, Susanne Hahn, co-founder and Managing Partner at 1886Ventures, Markus Mueller, Investment Manager at HYUNDAI CRADLE, and Willem Baudewijns, Managing Director Germany and the Netherlands at Polestar for sharing their insights during our panel discussion on topics ranging from the conditions needed for successful innovation, to the evolving role of an OEM, and future trends within the mobility investment landscape.

We can’t wait to see how the discussions and investment opportunities that we explored in Munich will be taken further and see how the innovations we heard about continue to evolve! 

#PioneerThePossible #Mobility #Innovation #EUPresidency

Reshoring, nearshoring, offshoring or simply regionalisation?
  
We believe in a geographic approach to regionalisation, which is more value-chain driven rather than purely cost-driven. 

Contact us to find out the best conditions for your operations: https://fal.cn/3vlb9

When deciding on supply chain localisation, OPEX and CAPEX should be balanced with other important requirements such as sustainability, macro aspects, labour, and supply chain performance. But identifying which country holds the most favourable conditions for your company is not always straightforward. 

We have evaluated key defining supply chain factors across 40 EMEA countries, providing a broad value chain perspective to help companies make the right supply chain decisions. 

Want to know more? Download our report today. https://lnkd.in/dduzAc5g

How do you navigate the 40+ EMEA countries to make the right supply chain decisions for your company?  

With insights and data, of course!  We have collated the vital information about supply chains into an automated digital tool 
– all designed to help your company make an informed decision.  

Let us help you grow your presence across EMEA – quickly and efficiently. https://lnkd.in/dduzAc5g

Have you signed up for Swiss Nordic Bio 2023?

With our co-host Vator Securities and partners The Life Science Cluster, UBS, Invest in Skåne, Business Region Göteborg, Embassy of Sweden as well as the Swiss Innovation Agency Innosuisse we are welcoming life science companies and investors this year in early spring. We hope to see you in Zurich as well!

With our main sponsor Nasdaq on board, we look forward to an engaging event.

To sign-up and for more information go to https://lnkd.in/dF8epvGd

On March 30, we will start of the conference with interesting panel discussions, continue with company presentations and use the afternoon for engaging matchmaking sessions. For more information, stay tuned!

Already +120 participants registered including +50 investors, +30 SMEs and 14 listed companies.

For the latest participant list, see this link here: https://lnkd.in/d6aMTKUS

#swissnordicbio #lifesciences #biotech #medtech #innovation #healthcare #ehealth #investment #healthcare #pharma #investors #digitalhealth #conference

Sweden is at the frontline of e-mobility innovation and the transformations of the automotive supply chain. This is partly demonstrated by record investments from abroad. 

By choosing Åmål, Västra Götaland County, as the location for a USD 50 million electrodynamics facility, Dana Inc, unlocked unique automtion and sustainabillity benefits. 

Find out how Business Sweden and its partner agencies helped one of the world's top 40 automotive suppliers navigate its next strategic step: https://fal.cn/3vlkE

With a new patented technology, Cavis Technologies AB has found a better way to accurately diagnose people with coronary artery diseases. And the future is looking bright. 

When the Swedish medtech pioneer wanted to gain a foothold in France, they turned to Business Sweden for local support.

“Business Sweden opened doors for us with large medical device companies and helped us evaluate relevant partners,” explains Helene Gustafsson, Global Application Specialist, Cavis. 

Find out more: https://fal.cn/3va09

Join the Swedish pavilion at Hannover Messe. This is the most important international platform and hot spot for industrial transformation. Together with other influential Swedish brands, you can increase you impact in a joint offer.

Germany is Sweden's largest trade partner. In 2019, Sweden was the partner country to Hannover Messe and invited actors from all over the world to innovate, go digital, be sustainable and collaborate. Now, we will follow up on our previous success with this Swedish pavilion. 

Secure your spot as a co-exhibitor in the Swedish pavilion before 25 January here: https://fal.cn/3v54n

Swedish and Italian representatives of life sciences met in Rome to discuss collaborations in Research and Development and digitalisation during the Italy-Sweden Life Science Seminar. 

Both countries have a strong pharmaceutical sector, prominent life science research and face the same challenges in healthcare that digitalisation can overcome. 

The event gathered an impressive lineup of participants for the roundtable discussions – Italian companies Chiesi Group, Angelini Pharma and Gemelli Digital Medicine & Health — GDMH, Swedish companies Hansa Biopharma, Mölnlycke, AstraZeneca and representatives from the strong clusters in each country – Cluster Nazionale Scienze della Vita ALISEI, Cluster lombardo scienze della vita, Cluster Campania Bioscience and the Swedish business incubator SmiLe Incubator

With a shared insight dedicated to building strong relationships in business, we believe there will be great opportunities for collaboration between the two countries. 

Read more about how we can guide you through the entire internationalisation process: https://fal.cn/3wg9C

#sweden #Italy #lifescience #collaboartion

As part of Sweden’s Presidency of the Council of the European Union, leading Swedish and Spanish companies in the green hydrogen sector met yesterday to exchange knowledge, ideas and experiences.

The shift to green hydrogen brings major opportunities and will contribute to the objectives of the EU Hydrogen Strategy and the REPower EU plan. Business Sweden coordinated today’s event in collaboration with the Embassy of Sweden in Madrid, Spain.

“Europe must lead by example, meeting emission reduction targets while at the same time boosting economic growth and competitiveness. To achieve this, it is important to further advance the renewable energy and green hydrogen agenda in the EU," said Teppo Tauriainen, Sweden’s Ambassador to Spain.

Focusing on the latest trends, the seminar provided an excellent opportunity to learn about the impact of green hydrogen across national and European economies.

A special thanks to all the panelists who are leaders in the green hydrogen sector in Sweden and Spain, including Repsol, Alfa Laval, ABB, Iberdrola, H2B2 Electrolysis Technologies, S.L., ACCIONA Energía, AFRY, H2 Green Steel and Grupo Fertiberia, and to our moderator Clara Arpa Azofra, CEO at ARPA Equipos Móviles de Campaña. Let's continue to #Pioneerthepossible.

Yesterday, Business Sweden co-hosted a seminar together with the Consulate General of Sweden in Shanghai on the topic “Green Transition through Innovation and Energy Efficiency” as part of the Swedish Presidency of Council of the European Union, welcoming more than 100 participants from business and politics. 

The seminar began with opening remarks from the Consul General of Sweden in Shanghai Ambassador Marie-Claire Swärd Capra, and two keynote speeches by Truls Borgström, from the Ministry of Climate and Enterprise of Sweden, and Yi Ma, from China Council for the Promotion of International Trade Shanghai.  

Business Sweden provided perspectives on how Swedish collaboration can unlock progress in the green transition, including Swedish ambitions and efforts to achieve carbon neutrality through working together with Chinese stakeholders. In addition, the seminar hosted a panel discussion with representatives from Alfa Laval , Air Liquide SHENERGY and SINOPEC about how private sectors are reshaping the business operations and upgrading offerings through innovation, transformation and collaboration in order to be more sustainable.  

We would like to extend a big thanks to all attendees to the event.  

Collaboration is the way to a more sustainable future.  

Together, let’s Pioneer the Possible!  https://fal.cn/3z4Vw

What are the potential, impact as well as synergies, complements and commitments for the Nordics hydrogen economy to increase collaboration?

In September 2022, Business Finland, Innovation Norway, Business Sweden and the The Swedish Energy Agency International initiated a study to explore the opportunities for increased Nordic Collaboration within the hydrogen economy, mapping the synergies and complements between Finland, Norway, Sweden, Denmark and Iceland, and the commitment for increased Nordic collaboration between the Trade Promotion Agencies (TPOs) based on industry priorities.

For the Nordics, hydrogen is considered a key enabler to decarbonize hard-to-abate industries and will play a key role from a green transition and business potential point of view.

The Nordics offer unique preconditions such as access to fossil free power systems, biogenic carbon, first mover ecosystems within key industries such as energy, industrial and transport, and a spirit to collaborate. This provides good prerequisites on both the clean hydrogen generation side as well as providing a testing ground for lighthouse projects on the application side, with a complementing value chain available in the region.  

Based on the report findings, the TPOs have agreed on the potential to formalize the collaboration going forward, as one of the carefully selected industries of collaboration.

We extend our warmest thanks to the +35 companies and organisations who shared their perspective with us during the conducting of the study!

#Hydrogen #NordicCollaboration

Swedish and German manufacturers, technology equipment providers, engineers and researchers are at the forefront of Europe’s efforts to reimagine the battery industry and together they are shaping the solutions of the future.

As part of Sweden holding the Presidency of the Council of the European Union for the first half of 2023, between 30.05. – 02.06. 2023 the Embassy of Sweden in Germany, together with Business Sweden and the The Swedish Energy Agency International hosted the Swedish-German Battery Delegation to Southern Germany.

The delegation brought together executives from leading battery companies from both countries in order to create concrete business dialogues, foster future pilot projects, and further the commercialisation of battery applications in a Swedish-German context.

During the 4 day delegation we visited battery cell manufactures, equipment manufacturers and research institutes including BMW Group, Technical University of Munich, TRUMPF, Karlsruher Institut für Technologie (KIT), Innolith and hte GmbH.

We were honored to bring together companies and innovators at the forefront of the Nordic battery landscape: Altris AB, APR Technologies AB, Cling Systems, Compular, Enerpoly, Epiroc, Granode Materials, Micropower Group, Northvolt, RISE, Volvo Group, The Swedish Energy Agency International and Business Finland.

Helge Stein, William Bergh, Anders Persson, Per Roos, Maciej Wysocki, Klas Sandrén, Robert Gorner, Nicolas F. Steinbacher, Mojtaba Gilzad Kohan, Richard Noren, Rishi Patel, Johannes Henriksson, Peter Nilsson, Anders Jonsson, Mylad Chamoun, Illka Homanen, Jonas Höglund, Stegrin Göran, Niclas Carlsson, Johan Holmlund, Jessica Olsson, Mathilda Blume, William Füller.

Visste du att Italien har fått störst andel av EUs återhämtningsplan? Missa inte vårt webinarie den 15 juni kl 14-15 där vi presenterar nya affärsmöjligheter inom sjöfart och marinteknik.

Inom ramen för stödpaketet till Italien allokeras 3.5 miljarder EUR till intermodalitet och integrerad logistik. Grön omställning och elektrifiering av hamnar och sjöfartssektorn står nu starkt i fokus.

Lyssna in på webinariet för att höra mer om investeringarna som nu görs. Du får insikt i konkreta projekt som tagit fart i Italien, samt hur svenska företag bör positionera sig i landets hamn- och sjöfartssektor.

Anmäl dig här: https://fal.cn/3yOxO

Last Friday, Business Sweden co-hosted a hybrid seminar together with Delegation of the European Union to China 欧盟驻华代表团 and the Embassy of Sweden in China on the topic “Between business and geopolitics: State of play and prospects for China’s digital economy”. 

The seminar included opening remarks from H.E. Ambassador Jorge Toledo Albiñana of the EU Delegation to China and H.E. Ambassador Helena Sångeland of the Embassy of Sweden in Beijing, a keynote speech by the Director of Tech Policy from Trivium China, and two panel discussions with representatives from the European Commission, ReedSmith, Alfa Laval, Sandvik Coromant and Tencent.

Throughout the seminar, participants disassembled facts and trends of the development of China’s digital economy, as well as opportunities and challenges from a business as well as policy perspective. 

After the seminar, speakers and guests from both political and business realms gathered for a mingling event to further exchange perspectives, providing a great opportunity for exchanged views.

We are proud to announce that our current Market Area Director for Africa and Trade Commissioner to Kenya, Andreas Giallourakis, has accepted to take on the position as Country Manager for Business Sweden's new office in Ukraine.

"I am happy and proud to have the opportunity to make a contribution in Ukraine during an immensely important phase in Ukraine's and Europe's history, focusing on reconstruction and guidance for Swedish companies and government agencies", says Andreas.

Starting 2024, Andreas will work full-time on Ukraine. Besides setting a more long-term plan for our focus areas for Ukraine going forward, Andreas will finalise the recruitment of a local senior individual who is going be our support on the ground in Ukraine.

Congratulations Andreas to this very important position for Sweden.

Read more: https://fal.cn/3zEWh

On 29 June 2023, Business Sweden, the Embassy of Sweden and Svenska Handelskammaren i Tyskland had the pleasure of hosting representatives of the Swedish business community in Germany at the Nordic Embassies in Berlin for an exclusive round table discussion on the results of the Business Climate Survey in Germany, 2023.

The Business Climate Survey maps the opportunities and challenges experienced by Swedish companies active on the German market. Encouragingly, 85 per cent of respondents consider the business climate in Germany to be between neutral to very good. The finished report with all the results and analysis can be accessed here https://fal.cn/3zwgm

A big thank you to all the respondents of the survey! The results of the German market will eventually form part of the Global Business Climate Survey, compiled by The Ministry for Foreign Affairs, Business Sweden and Chambers International (SCI), to be presented 30 August.

Finally, we would like to thank the participants of the roundtable, whose insights added further nuance to the results, and opened up interesting discussions on how Swedish companies can best succeed on the German market by leveraging their digital and sustainable offerings.

Andreas Reß | Berna Brandsæter | Sven Schreiber | Josef Hinterberger | Jenny Lennung Malmqvist | Sina Zwerger | Helen Hoffmann | Thomas Ryberg | Johan Holmlund

On 22 June, Business Sweden and Energimyndigheten hosted a session during the EUSEW Policy Conference in Brussels as part of the Sustainable Heating & Cooling by Sweden (SHC by Sweden) initiative.

The session focused on how Sweden, France and Bulgaria are driving the energy transition through carbon neutral heating, featuring speakers from Stockholm Exergi, Compagnie de Chauffage, Toplofikacia Sofia E.A.D., Alfa Laval, Siemens Energy, and Bulgaria's Ministry of Energy.

Were you unable to attend? Check out the recording via: https://fal.cn/3zqPp

Successful kick-off for the Sweden + Italy Green Alliance at the Swedish consulate in Milan with Business Sweden, The Ambasciata di Svezia in Italia, General Honorary Consul Marco Frazzica, De Berti Jacchia Franchini Forlani and 4 leading Swedish companies in Italy actively contributing to Italy’s green transition plan – Axel Johnson International AB, Hexagon Manufacturing Intelligence, OX2, Volvo Construction Equipment.

As Italy is continuing with its € 60 billion investment plan for green transition, there is a unique opportunity to position Sweden and Swedish companies with sustainability in their DNA as strategic partners to Italy and Italian companies in their path to a circular and carbon-neutral economy.

Sweden + Italy Green Alliance aims to create a cooperation and matchmaking platform to position Sweden and Swedish companies as strategic partners to Italy. The activities throughout the year consist of high-profile activities including industry roundtable discussions and B2B meetings with key public and private stakeholders.

For the Nordics, hydrogen is considered a key enabler to decarbonize hard-to-abate industries and will play a key role from a green transition and business potential point of view.

The Nordics offer unique preconditions such as access to fossil free power systems, biogenic carbon, first mover ecosystems within key industries such as energy, industrial and transport, and a spirit to collaborate. This provides good prerequisites on both the clean hydrogen generation side as well as providing a testing ground for lighthouse projects on the application side, with a complementing value chain available in the region.  

Based on the report findings, the TPOs have agreed on the potential to formalize the collaboration going forward, as one of the carefully selected industries of collaboration.

We extend our warmest thanks to the +35 companies and organisations who shared their perspective with us during the conducting of the study!

#Hydrogen #NordicCollaboration

Swedish and German manufacturers, technology equipment providers, engineers and researchers are at the forefront of Europe’s efforts to reimagine the battery industry and together they are shaping the solutions of the future.

As part of Sweden holding the Presidency of the Council of the European Union for the first half of 2023, between 30.05. – 02.06. 2023 the Embassy of Sweden in Germany, together with Business Sweden and the The Swedish Energy Agency International hosted the Swedish-German Battery Delegation to Southern Germany.

The delegation brought together executives from leading battery companies from both countries in order to create concrete business dialogues, foster future pilot projects, and further the commercialisation of battery applications in a Swedish-German context.

During the 4 day delegation we visited battery cell manufactures, equipment manufacturers and research institutes including BMW Group, Technical University of Munich, TRUMPF, Karlsruher Institut für Technologie (KIT), Innolith and hte GmbH.

We were honored to bring together companies and innovators at the forefront of the Nordic battery landscape: Altris AB, APR Technologies AB, Cling Systems, Compular, Enerpoly, Epiroc, Granode Materials, Micropower Group, Northvolt, RISE, Volvo Group, The Swedish Energy Agency International and Business Finland.

Helge Stein, William Bergh, Anders Persson, Per Roos, Maciej Wysocki, Klas Sandrén, Robert Gorner, Nicolas F. Steinbacher, Mojtaba Gilzad Kohan, Richard Noren, Rishi Patel, Johannes Henriksson, Peter Nilsson, Anders Jonsson, Mylad Chamoun, Illka Homanen, Jonas Höglund, Stegrin Göran, Niclas Carlsson, Johan Holmlund, Jessica Olsson, Mathilda Blume, William Füller.

We are proud to announce that our current Market Area Director for Africa and Trade Commissioner to Kenya, Andreas Giallourakis, has accepted to take on the position as Country Manager for Business Sweden's new office in Ukraine.

"I am happy and proud to have the opportunity to make a contribution in Ukraine during an immensely important phase in Ukraine's and Europe's history, focusing on reconstruction and guidance for Swedish companies and government agencies", says Andreas.

Starting 2024, Andreas will work full-time on Ukraine. Besides setting a more long-term plan for our focus areas for Ukraine going forward, Andreas will finalise the recruitment of a local senior individual who is going be our support on the ground in Ukraine.

Congratulations Andreas to this very important position for Sweden.

On 29 June 2023, Business Sweden, the Embassy of Sweden and Svenska Handelskammaren i Tyskland had the pleasure of hosting representatives of the Swedish business community in Germany at the Nordic Embassies in Berlin for an exclusive round table discussion on the results of the Business Climate Survey in Germany, 2023.

The Business Climate Survey maps the opportunities and challenges experienced by Swedish companies active on the German market. Encouragingly, 85 per cent of respondents consider the business climate in Germany to be between neutral to very good. The finished report with all the results and analysis can be accessed here https://fal.cn/3zwgm

A big thank you to all the respondents of the survey! The results of the German market will eventually form part of the Global Business Climate Survey, compiled by The Ministry for Foreign Affairs, Business Sweden and Chambers International (SCI), to be presented 30 August.

Finally, we would like to thank the participants of the roundtable, whose insights added further nuance to the results, and opened up interesting discussions on how Swedish companies can best succeed on the German market by leveraging their digital and sustainable offerings.

Andreas Reß | Berna Brandsæter | Sven Schreiber | Josef Hinterberger | Jenny Lennung Malmqvist | Sina Zwerger | Helen Hoffmann | Thomas Ryberg | Johan Holmlund

On 22 June, Business Sweden and Energimyndigheten hosted a session during the EUSEW Policy Conference in Brussels as part of the Sustainable Heating & Cooling by Sweden (SHC by Sweden) initiative.

The session focused on how Sweden, France and Bulgaria are driving the energy transition through carbon neutral heating, featuring speakers from Stockholm Exergi, Compagnie de Chauffage, Toplofikacia Sofia E.A.D., Alfa Laval, Siemens Energy, and Bulgaria's Ministry of Energy.

Were you unable to attend? Check out the recording via: https://fal.cn/3zqPp

Successful kick-off for the Sweden + Italy Green Alliance at the Swedish consulate in Milan with Business Sweden, The Ambasciata di Svezia in Italia, General Honorary Consul Marco Frazzica, De Berti Jacchia Franchini Forlani and 4 leading Swedish companies in Italy actively contributing to Italy’s green transition plan – Axel Johnson International AB, Hexagon Manufacturing Intelligence, OX2, Volvo Construction Equipment.

As Italy is continuing with its € 60 billion investment plan for green transition, there is a unique opportunity to position Sweden and Swedish companies with sustainability in their DNA as strategic partners to Italy and Italian companies in their path to a circular and carbon-neutral economy.

Sweden + Italy Green Alliance aims to create a cooperation and matchmaking platform to position Sweden and Swedish companies as strategic partners to Italy. The activities throughout the year consist of high-profile activities including industry roundtable discussions and B2B meetings with key public and private stakeholders.

Ludovica Frare | Beatrice Cavicchiolo | Elisa Alaiso | Marco Frazzica | Stefano Tacchinardi | Elena Pallicelli | Aleandro Azzaro | Gabriele Tanzi-Mira | Jan Björklund | Elena Biglietti | Massimiliano Gazzo |
Cesare Cassani | Levio Valetti | Maria Åkerlund De Francisco | Giuseppina Zoccali (LLM) | Maria Dahlberg 

Stay tuned for updates!

Yesterday, Business Sweden co-hosted a seminar together with the Consulate General of Sweden in Shanghai on the topic “Green Transition through Innovation and Energy Efficiency” as part of the Swedish Presidency of Council of the European Union, welcoming more than 100 participants from business and politics. 

The seminar began with opening remarks from the Consul General of Sweden in Shanghai Ambassador Marie-Claire Swärd Capra, and two keynote speeches by Truls Borgström, from the Ministry of Climate and Enterprise of Sweden, and Yi Ma, from China Council for the Promotion of International Trade Shanghai.  

Business Sweden provided perspectives on how Swedish collaboration can unlock progress in the green transition, including Swedish ambitions and efforts to achieve carbon neutrality through working together with Chinese stakeholders. In addition, the seminar hosted a panel discussion with representatives from Alfa Laval , Air Liquide SHENERGY and SINOPEC about how private sectors are reshaping the business operations and upgrading offerings through innovation, transformation and collaboration in order to be more sustainable.  

We would like to extend a big thanks to all attendees to the event.  

Collaboration is the way to a more sustainable future.  

Together, let’s Pioneer the Possible!  https://fal.cn/3z4Vw

E-world energy & water äger rum 20-22 februari 2024 och vänder sig till intressenter inom energibranschen. Eventet erbjuder en omfattande exponering för såväl tyska som internationella kunder och investerare. 

– Mässor spelar en avgörande roll i den tyska affärsvärlden, både för att bygga nätverk och göra affärer, säger Ludvig Lindström, senior affärsutvecklare på Energimyndigheten. 

Energimyndigheten, i samarbete med Tysk-Svenska Handelskammaren och Business Sweden, kommer stå värd för den svenska energipaviljongen.

Business Sweden, together with the Embassy of Sweden in Italy and the Italian-Swedish Chamber of Commerce - Assosvezia, organized a panel conference on Sustainable Cities, with the objective to foster knowledge exchange and to strengthen the Swedish-Italian relations on green transition and digital transformation of urban environments.

The industry-focused panel discussion gathered key experts, industry leaders, government stakeholders and technology providers to cover topics linked to the development of smart and sustainable cities, including: 
• Zero emission cities and urban mobility
• Digital transformation in cities
• Cooperation between private and public stakeholders for sustainable cities

The panel discussions were followed by networking lunch and bilateral meetings between Swedish and Italian companies.

Thank you AMAT Agenzia Mobilità, Ambiente e Territorio, A2A, ALIA SERVIZI AMBIENTALI SpA, Gruppo Hera, TIM as well as Axel Johnson International AB, Hexagon AB, Volvo Cars, Volvo Construction Equipment and yodiwo for joining this event.

Our Country Manager, Andreas Giallourakis, completed his first trip to Ukraine a few weeks ago. 

Shortly after Business hosted a luncheon at our headquarters where representatives from Swedish companies with a significant presence in Ukraine participated, he embarked on his first journey towards his new mission to restart Business Sweden’s physical presence in Ukraine.

The trip began with a visit to Warsaw, and from there, he traveled by train to Kyiv. During his visit, he spent a lot of time with our new colleague, Yevhenii Shakotko, who will be working as our local representative in Ukraine. They spent most of the week on onboarding and planning for the upcoming work. During the trip, they met the new Swedish ambassador to Ukraine, active companies in the country, the Swedish Embassy, Sida, and other partners that will play a significant role in the rebuilding of Ukraine.

Read more about Andreas' visit in this morning's edition of Dagens Industri, where he spoke about future needs in Ukraine and how Swedish companies can contribute to the reconstruction.

The presentation of the report was followed by a panel discussion including Ingka Centres DIAVERUM Portugal and QueensLab, and finished off with a fika in classic Swedish style. A warm thank you to our panelists whose insights added further nuance to the results and ignited insightful discussions!

Our most sincere gratitude to all participating companies for your valuable input!

The Business Climate Survey in Spain is now officially launched! 
 
This Thursday, Business Sweden in collaboration with the Embassy of Sweden, the Swedish-Spanish Chamber of Commerce in Madrid and the Swedish-Spanish Chamber of Commerce in Barcelona organized an exclusive launch event to present the main results of the Business Climate Survey in Spain, as well as the highlights of the global survey for all Swedish companies abroad, followed by an evening of networking with the Swedish business community in Spain.
 
The annual survey is carried out to capture the first-hand experiences and views of Swedish companies abroad, and this was the third year the survey was conducted in Spain.
 
Some key findings from this year’s survey are:

- Swedish companies’ perception of the current business climate in Spain has improved compared to last year’s responses 💪 

- The investment appetite is to a large extent, in line with last year’s 📈 

- A slightly increased share of Swedish companies confirm that their customers care about the environmental aspects 🍃 
 
We would also like to extend our most sincere gratitude to the participating companies for the knowledge and insights that they have shared with us – for the benefit of us all. 

Please find the full survey results here: https://lnkd.in/dcwYzJ5m 

Embassy of Sweden in Madrid, Spain, Cámara de Comercio Hispano-Sueca de Barcelona, Cámara de Comercio Hispano-Sueca de Barcelona, Teppo Tauriainen, Samira Grylin Allalou, Daniel Fuentes Castro, Jaime Huidobro Ramiro Ortiz, Anna Fransson, Manuela Stierna.

“We are very proud to have been commissioned by the Swedish government to establish an office in Kyiv. Business Sweden is facilitating discussions that look beyond the war. Swedish companies are firmly committed to play an important role in the reconstruction of a modern Ukraine, and to help the country rebuild using the technologies of tomorrow.”

Read more about business opportunities as Ukraine rebuilds: https://brnw.ch/21wDMes

A big thank you must go to Jane Cooper, Director of Offshore Wind, RenewableUK, Karl John, Offshore Wind Specialist, Department for Business and Trade, Ben Miller, Development Manager, Crown Estate Scotland, Laura Fleming, CEO, Hitachi Energy UK and Ireland, Luciana Mendes, Clean Tech Business Development Manager, Alfa Laval and Pedro Patacão, Senior Vice President and Head of Offshore Wind Global Execution Center ABB

Business Sweden tillsammans med Energimyndigheten och Tysk-Svenska Handelskammaren står värd för den svenska energipaviljongen och visar upp ett starkt svenskt erbjudande för den internationella marknaden. Mässan går av stapeln 20-22 februari 2024. Läs mer nedan.
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
Nu har svenska företag möjlighet att visa upp sina innovativa och hållbara lösningar för aktörer på den tyska marknaden. Boka er plats i den svenska energipaviljongen på E-world!

E-world energy & water äger rum 20-22 februari 2024 och vänder sig till intressenter inom energibranschen. Eventet erbjuder en omfattande exponering för såväl tyska som internationella kunder och investerare. 

– Mässor spelar en avgörande roll i den tyska affärsvärlden, både för att bygga nätverk och göra affärer, säger Ludvig Lindström, senior affärsutvecklare på Energimyndigheten. 

Energimyndigheten, i samarbete med Tysk-Svenska Handelskammaren och Business Sweden, kommer stå värd för den svenska energipaviljongen. 

Reservera er plats senast 29 oktober: https://lnkd.in/gnAwJEmW

#Innovation #Cleantech #Industry

company_updates_collection.description:
Business Sweden, together with the Embassy of Sweden in Italy and the Italian-Swedish Chamber of Commerce - Assosvezia, organized a panel conference on Sustainable Cities, with the objective to foster knowledge exchange and to strengthen the Swedish-Italian relations on green transition and digital transformation of urban environments.

The industry-focused panel discussion gathered key experts, industry leaders, government stakeholders and technology providers to cover topics linked to the development of smart and sustainable cities, including: 
• Zero emission cities and urban mobility
• Digital transformation in cities
• Cooperation between private and public stakeholders for sustainable cities

The panel discussions were followed by networking lunch and bilateral meetings between Swedish and Italian companies.

Thank you AMAT Agenzia Mobilità, Ambiente e Territorio, A2A, ALIA SERVIZI AMBIENTALI SpA, Gruppo Hera, TIM as well as Axel Johnson International AB, Hexagon AB, Volvo Cars, Volvo Construction Equipment and yodiwo for joining this event.

#SwedenItalyGreenAlliance, #SustainableCities, #SmartCities

New market?
Need a desk or office space?
We can help!

Are you interested in expanding your business in the South European Agri-Tech sector? Then this webinar is for you! 

On October 30th at 11:30 - 12:45 CET, Business Sweden is organising a webinar to dive into the promising agri-tech sector in Southern Europe with Barilla Group as a guest speaker.

Listen in to gain insights and a better understanding of agri-tech in Italy and Spain, as well as the opportunities for Swedish companies to position themselves in the sector 🍃
 
We will explore current industry trends, challenges and opportunities for Swedish solutions and innovations in a strategic sector with great social, territorial, environmental, and economic importance. Worth noting is that Italy and Spain are the largest beneficiaries of the NextGenerationEU funds, with a total allocation of €6.32 billion for the sustainable development, modernisation, and digital transformation of the agri-food sector 🙌
 
Don’t miss out on this opportunity and register through the following link: https://brnw.ch/21wDy4n.

Last week, Business Sweden had the honor of hosting a delegation to Stockholm from Madrid Nuevo Norte (MNN) - one of the largest urban development projects in Europe. Madrid Nuevo Norte is based on a 100% sustainable city model and boasts astonishing investments of €25.2 billion. The delegation consisted of representatives from Comunidad de Madrid and Crea Madrid Nuevo Norte and aimed to foster meaningful long-term connections as well as underscore the significant opportunities that MNN presents for Sweden and Swedish companies.
 
The 2-day program aimed to explore leading Swedish innovation and included a sustainable construction seminar with Swedish large cap and SME companies, visits to leading actors like SSAB, Envac and Ericsson, a tour of Stockholm Royal Seaport and bilateral dialogues with key representatives from the Swedish Government and the City of Stockholm.
 
Let's build on this momentum and continue our collaboration in shaping innovative, sustainable, and inclusive cities, mirroring the vision of Madrid Nuevo Norte. Feel free to reach out to Luciano Robaina Benitez if your company is interested in hearing more regarding Madrid Nuevo Norte or Spain in general.

Business Sweden and the Embassy of Sweden London, UK had the pleasure of hosting an Anglo-Swedish Nuclear Symposium on Tuesday 21 November at the Swedish Ambassador’s Residence.

The forum brought together business leaders, public agencies, industry associations and experts from both the UK and Sweden for a memorable evening of networking, panels and dinner discussions.

This event follows the strategic partnership signed by Swedish Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson and UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak, aimed at ‘reinvigorated and deepened cooperation’ across a multitude of areas including nuclear reactor technologies, including small modular reactors, and efforts to diversify nuclear fuel supplies.

A big thank you must go to Lincoln Hill, Director for External Affairs, Nuclear Industry Association, Andrew Bowie, Minister for Nuclear and Networks, Department for Energy Security and Net Zero, Daniel Liljeberg, State Secretary to Minister for Energy, Business and Industry, Ebba Busch, Regeringskansliet, Klimat- och näringslivsdepartementet, John C. H. Lindberg FRSA, President, Swedish Nuclear Society, Martin Darelius, Senior Advisor Nuclear Technology, Vattenfall, David Fletcher, Head of Policy, Sizewell C, Alastair Evans, Director of Corporate and Government Affairs, Rolls Royce SMR, Laurent Odeh Chief Commercial Officer, Urenco Group

Therese W., Clara Korsgren, Maria Wennberg, Gustaf B., Samiksha Jalan, Qahir Bandali, David Cameron, Carl-Oscar Westerlund

Business Sweden, the Swedish Embassy in Spain, the City of Bilbao, and the City of Malmö organized an influential high-level program, uniting companies and institutions at the forefront of the green transition 🍃

Bilbao, mirroring the ambitions of several Swedish cities, including Malmö, is committed to robust sustainability agendas for 2030 and is currently undertaking an ambitious Smart City development in the city with the regeneration of Zorrotzaurre.

This occasion significantly reinforced the collaboration between Sweden and Bilbao, emphasizing the exchange of best practices and fostering long-term dialogues.

We express our sincere gratitude to Juan Mari Aburto, Teppo Tauriainen, Xabier Ochandiano, Eider Inunciaga Serna, Javier Garcinuño Zabala, Javier Font and Jonas Kamleh, and would also like to acknowledge the invaluable contributions of our esteemed alliance members: AFRY, Alfa Laval, EasyPark Group, Fagerhult Spain, OX2, Scania Spain, Securitas Seguridad España, SENS Sustainable Energy Solutions, Swegon España, Universal Kraft.

https://lnkd.in/dsF8ydeB
Aclima, Basque Environment cluster

Let's continue to #PioneerThePossible!
#TeamSwedenInSpain

Get ready for the return of the Mobility Innovation Forum! 🚀

Business Sweden, in collaboration with Veronika Wand Danielsson, the Ambassador of Sweden to Germany, are thrilled to announce the second edition of the Mobility Innovation Forum, following the success of the gathering this January.

The Mobility Innovation Forum 2024, an exclusive investment matchmaking event, will take place on 23rd January 2024 in the beautiful setting of Bayerischer Hof in Munich. 

Leading German OEMs, Tier 1s and VCs will converge with innovative Swedish start-ups revolutionising the Nordic mobility landscape for a day of inspiring discussions, pitching sessions and networking opportunities, followed by a vibrant dinner.

We are looking forward to welcoming investors and innovators reshaping the future of European mobility in Munich. If you would like more information please reach out to rosie.downer@business-sweden.se.

#PioneerThePossible #Mobility #Innovation

Business Sweden and Ambassade de Suède en France (the Embassy of Sweden in France) organised a high-level conference on Smart and Sustainable Freight Transport.
The conference aimed at sharing insights and showcasing solutions that enable green & digital transition within freight transport around three thematic:
·      Decarbonization of road transport
·      Green and Efficient Last-Mile Services
·      Digital transformation, Connected and Autonomous Transport
 
The conference gathered 70+ participants from key institutions and organisations in the EU, France, and Sweden within the freight transport ecosystem, spanning from government entities to logistics companies, OEMs as well as technology and service providers.

Save the date for SWISS NORDIC BIO 2024 our annual high-level partnering and investor conference for life science professionals from Switzerland and the Nordics.

See https://brnw.ch/21wEbIr for more information and to see already registered guests.

#healthcare #lifesciences #medtech #biotech #pharma #swissnordicbio #conference #digitalhealth #innovation #investors

The initiative brought together private companies, public organisations, industry associations, and experts from both the United Kingdom & Sweden for a memorable two days of site visits, networking, and knowledge exchanges!

We also had the pleasure of listening to a pitching session with our SHC by Sweden -members Crossbreed AB, Cetetherm, PG Monitoring System AB, Mittel, Powerpipe Systems AB, Noda, SWEP, and Energy Opticon AB.

On Friday, Gustaf Bergström, the Trade Commissioner for the UK and Ireland, represented Business Sweden at a roundtable discussion on protecting critical infrastructure. The event was organized in collaboration with H.E. Ambassador Lina van der Weyden of the Swedish Embassy in Dublin and Ericsson. High-level attendees included Ossian Smyth T.D., Irish Minister of State for Public Procurement and eGovernment, and Erik Slottner, Sweden's Minister for Public Administration and digital infrastructure. 

“In a challenging geopolitical context, it is inspiring to see the solutions for critical infrastructure protection provided by leading Irish and Swedish companies, such as Ericsson and Saab, to name a few”, said Bergström. He added: “From Business Sweden’s side, we are keen to see further exchange and collaboration between leading digitalisation countries such as Sweden and Ireland and our companies. 

This message was reinforced by Minister Slottner: “In an interconnected world it is important that our critical digital infrastructure is robust and resilient. Subsea cables through the Arctic and 5G/6G will contribute to ensuring global secure connectivity as well as increased capacity in the network. This will have a positive impact on the European economy, competitiveness, the public sector and businesses.”

Business Sweden’s London team were thrilled to co-organise yesterday’s third bilateral UK-Sweden Business Forum, hosted by H E Ambassador Stefan Gullgren, Embassy of Sweden London, UK. 

Building on the UK-Sweden Strategic Partnership, this year’s Business Forum roundtable focused on how to achieve the #GreenTransition through trade, specifically within the areas of Sustainable Construction and Transportation/Logistics.

On May 30th, Business Sweden gathered stakeholders from the Swedish and Norwegian ecosystem within construction on the topic of How to Scale Sustainable Solutions in the Norwegian construction industry. Stakeholders included architects, contractors, property developers including municipalities from Norway, meeting Swedish companies offering solutions and lower the carbon footprint in various ways.

During the panel discussion, the panellists highlighted key points for successfully introducing innovative solutions:
-Ensure a holistic approach by bringing all heads together - actors from across the value chain need to be at the table for joint decision making
-Transparency and comparability on solutions' environmental performance throughout the entire life cycle are key when deciding on solutions
-New solutions are already here to be scaled - next will be to focus on reuse, redesign and repurpose of material and renovation of existing buildings

Thank you to Bodil Motzke, Oslobygg KF i Oslo kommune, Emil Andersson, LINK Arkitektur and Robert Jansson, HENT AS for sharing your insights!

During the day, we also got to hear from Swedish companies Inwoco, RECOMA, OrganoWood AB and POJI AB presenting their solutions. The day concluded with a visit to Fyrstikkbakken 14, hosted by LINK Arkitektur and Birk & Co AS.

Business Sweden wants to extend their thanks to all attendees, to Sveriges ambassad i Oslo for hosting at their premises, to LINK Arkitektur & Birk & Co AS for hosting the site visit, and the Circular Bioeconomy Arena for the support along the way, represented by Paper Province during the day.

Woodbe Engineering AB, Martinsons, Stora Enso, Backe, Asker kommune, Bærum kommune Eiendom, AB Invest AS

Hot off the press - Business Sweden’s local team in London are delighted to present the findings of the fifth consecutive Business Climate Survey (BCS) for the United Kingdom.  

With Team Sweden partners Embassy of Sweden London, UK  and Swedish Chamber of Commerce for the UK, Business Sweden welcome the key results from this year’s survey, including:  

• 60% of respondent companies describe their company’s financial performance in 2023 as profitable 
• 81% expect their industry turnover to increase, while 54% plan for increased investments in the upcoming 12 months 
• A majority finds that the “Swedish brand” contributes positively to their business in the UK.  

Curious about the full survey results? The 2024 BCS UK is available to download here: https://brnw.ch/21wKpOz or get in contact directly with the London team tagged in comments.  

The publication comes ahead of the global BCS launch on 14th June with Business Sweden CEO Jan Larsson and Chief Economist Lena Sellgren. 

There’s still time to register for the launch event: https://brnw.ch/21wKpOy

Within the Sustainable Heating & Cooling by Sweden (SHC by Sweden) program, Business Sweden, The Swedish Energy Agency International and SweHeat organised a two-day study tour on heat pumps in district heating networks. This event, held in Gothenburg and Mölndal on 10-11 September, included cooperation with BIHES and Baltic district heating associations. BIHES (Baltic Innovative Hybrid Energy System) is a project co-funded by the Swedish Institute under the SI Baltic Sea Neighbourhood Programme. Over 70 stakeholders from Estonia, France, Latvia, Lithuania, Poland, the UK, and Sweden attended to explore Swedish solutions combining heat pumps, CHP, and DH networks.

The tour provided participants to visit Krokslätt Energy System and Gothenburg Energy's Heat Pump Plant, along with presentations from over 15 SHC member companies. Key aspects highlighted included:

- Enhanced Energy Efficiency: Integration of heat pumps with renewable sources like biofuels and waste heat recovery improves efficiency and reduces CO2 emissions.
- Scalability of Heat Pump Solutions: Versatility from large-scale systems to smaller applications addresses diverse energy needs.
- Innovative System Design: Advanced designs optimise heat distribution and energy use with sophisticated control systems.
- Collaborative Approaches: Emphasis on partnerships between public authorities, energy companies, users, and technology providers.
- Asset Management: Solutions for smart asset management, including predictive maintenance and leak prevention.
- Future Trends and Opportunities: Emerging trends like AI for system optimisation and district cooling integration.

We encourage continued dialogue and thank all participants and partners for their engagement. Stay connected via the Sustainable Heating & Cooling by Sweden (SHC by Sweden).

Within the Sustainable Heating & Cooling by Sweden (SHC by Sweden) program, Business Sweden, The Swedish Energy Agency International and SweHeat organised a two-day study tour on heat pumps in district heating networks. This event, held in Gothenburg and Mölndal on 10-11 September, included cooperation with BIHES and Baltic district heating associations. BIHES (Baltic Innovative Hybrid Energy System) is a project co-funded by the Swedish Institute under the SI Baltic Sea Neighbourhood Programme. Over 70 stakeholders from Estonia, France, Latvia, Lithuania, Poland, the UK, and Sweden attended to explore Swedish solutions combining heat pumps, CHP, and DH networks.

The tour provided participants to visit Krokslätt Energy System and Gothenburg Energy's Heat Pump Plant, along with presentations from over 15 SHC member companies. Key aspects highlighted included:

- Enhanced Energy Efficiency: Integration of heat pumps with renewable sources like biofuels and waste heat recovery improves efficiency and reduces CO2 emissions.
- Scalability of Heat Pump Solutions: Versatility from large-scale systems to smaller applications addresses diverse energy needs.
- Innovative System Design: Advanced designs optimise heat distribution and energy use with sophisticated control systems.
- Collaborative Approaches: Emphasis on partnerships between public authorities, energy companies, users, and technology providers.
- Asset Management: Solutions for smart asset management, including predictive maintenance and leak prevention.
- Future Trends and Opportunities: Emerging trends like AI for system optimisation and district cooling integration.

We encourage continued dialogue and thank all participants and partners for their engagement. Stay connected via the Sustainable Heating & Cooling by Sweden (SHC by Sweden).

Given the increasing focus on sustainable heating solutions, Sustainable Heating & Cooling by Sweden (SHC by Sweden) hosted the first Anglo-Swedish Heating Days last week. In collaboration with Energimyndigheten, Business Sweden, and the Swedish Embassy In London, United Kingdom, we welcomed Swedish company representatives to the UK for a two-day programme.

Highlights included site visits to Metropolitan Energy's Wembley Park and E.ON UKs  Ectrogrid in Silvertown. Keynote speeches were delivered by Cantor Mocke from the Department for Energy Security and Net Zero on ‘The future of the UK’s Heat Networks Market’ and Sofie Fjellgren from the Swedish Energy Agency on ‘How Sweden Decarbonised its heating’.

Four panel discussions covered future energy systems, recovered heat, regulatory topics, and public-private partnerships, moderated by Sarah Honan and Caroline Bragg from The Association for Decentralised Energy.

The programme partners were inspired by the innovative solutions from Swedish companies who joined us for this delegation, such as Alfa Laval, Crossbreed, HYDRONIC NETWORKS LTD, FVB Sverige AB, NIBE, NODA Intelligent Systems, Vattenfall, and Qvantum Sverige.

We look forward to continuing this initiative with SHC-member companies and programme partners in London, Stockholm, and beyond!

On 21 November, the Swedish-German Business Day 2024 took place at the Nordic Embassies in Berlin, focusing on collaboration for a safer Europe. To summarise the discussions, we talked about:

- Sweden’s NATO entry and strategic innovation partnership with Germany in security, defence, and space are crucial for cooperation.
- The triple helix approach – collaboration between academia, industry, and government – is essential for developing resilient technologies.
- Dual-use items for civilian and military applications are vital for European peace and security.
- Sweden and Germany can collaborate in space, including science services, satellite networks, spacecraft operations, and rocket tests.
- The decentralised nature of renewable energy increases cyberattack risks, necessitating resilient energy networks. 

A big thank you to all the distinguished speakers, participants and  to the Embassy of Sweden in Germany and the Schwedische Handelskammer in der Bundesrepublik Deutschland.

Let’s keep building bridges for innovation!
Veronika Wand Danielsson, Marcus Wandt, Marco Gumbrecht, Andreas Giallourakis, Karl Hallding, Jonas Kellner, Jan Schulte, Enrique Kremers, John Hunter, Dr. Thorsten Henkel, Tatiana Brandt

Business Sweden’s local team were thrilled to this week co-host the Innovation & New Technologies business programme with the newly opened Embassy of Sweden in Ireland.  

Following the Embassy Grand Opening with Minister Johan Forssell and Ambassador Lina van der Weyden, Business Sweden arranged two activity tracks exploring opportunities for strengthened Swedish-Irish bilateral and business collaboration: 

• Digital Health roundtable: participants explored advancing healthcare delivery through partnerships between the government and the private sector. Brilliantly chaired by Innovation Professor Martin Curley, discussions covered key topics such as the importance of standardised data integration, the need for policy reforms and streamlined processes to foster the growth of digital health initiatives. 

• Net Zero Business Forum: following a presentation on Ireland’s Net-Zero Transformation at the Department of the Environment, Climate and Communications, Climate and Communication, participants at the Net Zero Business Forum identified opportunities for further Swedish-Irish collaboration and partnerships for innovation, such as sustainable transport, wind and heat networks. In a wide-ranging discussion expertly moderated by Assistant Secretary Gary Tobin at the Department of Enterprise, Trade and Employment, the need for government policy, access to sustainable energy and efficiency was emphasized, as well as the importance of consumer adoption of new technologies and skills. 

AstraZeneca, Getinge, Ericsson, Alfa Laval, STENA LINE (UK) LIMITED, Volvo Bus UK & Ireland, SIEMENS GAMESA RENEWABLE ENERGY AB, Saab, Volvo Cars, IKEA

On 21 November, the Swedish-German Business Day 2024 took place at the Nordic Embassies in Berlin, focusing on collaboration for a safer Europe. To summarise the discussions, we talked about:

- Sweden’s NATO entry and strategic innovation partnership with Germany in security, defence, and space are crucial for cooperation.
- The triple helix approach – collaboration between academia, industry, and government – is essential for developing resilient technologies.
- Dual-use items for civilian and military applications are vital for European peace and security.
- Sweden and Germany can collaborate in space, including science services, satellite networks, spacecraft operations, and rocket tests.
- The decentralised nature of renewable energy increases cyberattack risks, necessitating resilient energy networks. 

A big thank you to all the distinguished speakers, participants and  to the Embassy of Sweden in Germany and the Schwedische Handelskammer in der Bundesrepublik Deutschland.

Let’s keep building bridges for innovation!
Veronika Wand Danielsson, Marcus Wandt, Marco Gumbrecht, Andreas Giallourakis, Karl Hallding, Jonas Kellner, Jan Schulte, Enrique Kremers, John Hunter, Dr. Thorsten Henkel, Tatiana Brandt

Read the new release of the State of Electrification, developed by Electrification Hub in collaboration with Business Sweden. This time a special comprehensive edition -  Lessons from 2024 & The Road to 2025.

Key Insights from the report:
• 2024 marked a year of stagnating EV sales in Europe & the U.S.:
While China remains the dominant EV market, stricter regulations, low EV margins, and shifting subsidies are reshaping the EU and US landscape. What could boost the EV demand in 2025 and what regulatory updates can we expect?

• Heavy-duty electrification progresses, but grid capacity remains a challenge:
With major players like Volvo Group and Scania Group expanding their electric truck offerings, we are getting close to cost of ownership parity with diesel counterparts, but can investments in high-power charging networks keep up?

The fifth edition of Swedish Beauty at Cosmoprof Worldwide Bologna, held from the 20th to the 22nd of March was an incredible success! Cosmoprof Bologna is one of the world’s largest cosmetics and beauty fairs, attracting international retailers, distributors, partners and journalists. Over 255,000 attendees from more than 150 countries attended the event, meeting over 3,100 exhibitors from 65 countries.

A huge thank you to all the Swedish companies for making Swedish Beauty a shining example for the entire beauty industry:
• BALMID – offering colourful cosmetic accessories and sustainable body care products under the Soft Spell and Body Lab brands
• Group Beconfident Europe AB – enhancing self-esteem and holistic health with oral health and teeth whitening products
• Gents – Blending sophisticated ingredients with traditional craftsmanship for men’s grooming and fragrances
• EDO STHLM – Combining beauty and masculinity with sustainable, high-quality products produced locally
• i am by Swedish haircare – Produces multifunctional hair care products with eco-conscious ingredients for a climate-smart future
• Dermarome, ledande agentur inom hudvård och makeup – offering gentle beauty products for sensitive skin through their Löwengrip brand, and professional science-based skincare with Priori.
• Minolei – serving various skin types with base makeup products for everyday users and professionals
• Suntribe AB – revolutionizing the sunscreen industry by using sae, natural ingredients
• Under Your Skin – creating beauty products that are gentle on the body and for the environment, without any harsh synthetic ingredients
• Xlash – Specialized in lashes, brows, and eye care products, focusing on authenticity, inclusivity, and innovation

A special thank you also to the Ambasciata di Svezia in Italia, H.E. Jan Björklund Ambassador of Sweden to Italy, and Trade Promotion Officer Mrs. Maria Ermanno, and to our Swedish Honorary Consulate and Honorary Consul of Sweden in Bologna, Mr. Gianni Baravelli, for joining us during our common dinner and for the inauguration of the pavilion.

We would like to thank our amazing sponsors Atria Sweden, Flowlife and TetraPak! Our sincere thanks also go to Innovation Norway for facilitating our successful Nordic collaboration.

Looking forward to seeing you again next year at Cosmoprof Worldwide Bologna, 26-28th of March 2026! If you would like to know more about Cosmoprof, please contact monica.sommarvinge@business-sweden.se
